Authors:
Shi-Ke Huang, Rajesh JEEWON, Kevin D Hyde, Jayarama D.
Bhat, Ting-Chi Wen, Putatak Chomnunti
Title:
Novel taxa within Nectriaceae: Cosmosporella gen. nov. and
Aquanectria sp. nov. from freshwater habitats in China
Keywords:
aquatic fungi / morphology / multigene phylogeny /
phylogeny / sexual morph / Sordariomycetes
Abstract:
To clarify phylogenetic relationships among Aquanectria,
Cosmospora, Fusicolla and other related taxa in Nectriaceae, we examined
detailed morphological characters and performed cladistic analyses of a
concatenated dataset based on the ITS, LSU and Î²-tubulin DNA sequences
of fungal specimens collected from freshwater habitats in China. A new
genus, Cosmosporella, is described to accommodate C. olivacea as its
type species. Cosmospora obscura is transferred to Cosmosporella based
on morphological similarities and phylogenetic support. Aquanectria
jacinthicolor, a freshwater lignicolous taxon, characterized by its
orange ascomata and ellipsoid ascospores with broad paraphyses is a
newly described freshwater species. This species has affinities with
other two known species of Aquanectria and can be distinguished based on
ascospore morphology. A specimen with sexual morph of Fusicolla
aquaeductuum is reported for the first time.
